directions: Pour the milk into a large pot and heat it over low heat.
Simmer the milk gently, stirring occasionally, until it reduces by 90% and thickens.
Remove from heat and let it cool slightly.
Transfer the thickened milk to a silicone baking mat or a parchment-lined baking sheet.
Spread the milk into a thin layer, making sure it is evenly distributed.
Allow the milk to air dry completely, which can take up to 24 hours.
Once dry, use a blender or food processor to blitz the dried milk into a fine powder.
Store the milk powder in an airtight container.
Use as desired in recipes or reconstitute with water to make liquid milk.
